basics/converting-colors.title: Converting Colors
basics/converting-colors.description: Negarity Color supports seamless conversion between all supported color spaces. You can convert any color to any other color space using the appropriate conversion method.

basics/creating-colors.title: Creating Colors
basics/creating-colors.description: Negarity Color provides multiple ways to create color instances. This guide covers all the available methods.

basics/getting-channels.title: Getting Channels
basics/getting-channels.description: Every color in Negarity Color consists of channels that represent the color's values in its color space. This guide shows you how to access these channel values.

basics/modifying-colors.title: Modifying Colors
basics/modifying-colors.description: Negarity Color provides methods to modify colors by changing channel values. Since the default Color class is immutable, these methods return new color instances rather than modifying the original.

extending/color-names.title: Adding Color Names
extending/color-names.description: This guide shows you how to create custom color registries with your own named colors.

extending/color-spaces.title: Adding New Color Spaces
extending/color-spaces.description: This guide shows you how to extend Negarity Color by adding custom color spaces.

extending/extractors.title: Adding Extractors
extending/extractors.description: This guide shows you how to create custom extractors for analyzing colors.

extending/filters.title: Adding Filters
extending/filters.description: This guide shows you how to create custom filters for color transformations.

filters/blend.title: Blend Filter
filters/blend.description: The Blend filter combines two colors by averaging their channel values (50/50 blend).

filters/brightness.title: Brightness Filter
filters/brightness.description: The Brightness filter adjusts the brightness of a color by adding or subtracting a value from its channels.

filters/contrast.title: Contrast Filter
filters/contrast.description: The Contrast filter adjusts the contrast of a color by expanding or compressing the difference between light and dark values.

filters/difference.title: Difference Filter
filters/difference.description: The Difference filter calculates the absolute difference between two colors, useful for color comparison and analysis.

filters/gamma.title: Gamma Filter
filters/gamma.description: The Gamma filter applies gamma correction to adjust the brightness curve of a color, typically used for display calibration.

filters/grayscale.title: Grayscale Filter
filters/grayscale.description: The Grayscale filter converts a color to grayscale by removing color information and keeping only the luminance.

filters/hue-rotate.title: Hue Rotate Filter
filters/hue-rotate.description: The Hue Rotate filter shifts the hue of a color around the color wheel by a specified number of degrees.

filters/introduction.title: Introduction to Filters
filters/introduction.description: Filters are transformations that you can apply to colors to modify their appearance. Negarity Color provides a flexible filter system that supports three types of filters: Unary, Parameterized, and Binary.

filters/invert.title: Invert Filter
filters/invert.description: The Invert filter inverts all color channels, creating a negative image effect.

filters/mix.title: Mix Filter
filters/mix.description: The Mix filter combines two colors with a custom weight ratio, giving you control over how much of each color appears in the result.

filters/posterize.title: Posterize Filter
filters/posterize.description: The Posterize filter reduces the number of color levels, creating a posterized effect with fewer distinct colors.

filters/saturation.title: Saturation Filter
filters/saturation.description: The Saturation filter adjusts the color saturation, making colors more or less vivid.

filters/threshold.title: Threshold Filter
filters/threshold.description: The Threshold filter converts a color to pure black or white based on a threshold value, creating a binary (two-color) effect.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Welcome to Negarity Color! This guide will help you get started with the library by showing a simple application example.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Welcome to Negarity Color â€” a modern, extensible color manipulation library for PHP.

mutability/introduction.title: Immutable vs Mutable Colors
mutability/introduction.description: Negarity Color provides two color classes: Color (immutable) and MutableColor (mutable). Understanding the difference helps you choose the right one for your use case.

named-colors/introduction.title: Introduction to Named Colors
named-colors/introduction.description: Named colors allow you to create colors using human-readable names like "red", "blue", or "navy" instead of numeric values. Negarity Color supports named colors through a flexible registry system.

references/color-spaces.title: Color Spaces Reference
references/color-spaces.description: This is a complete reference for all color spaces supported by Negarity Color.

references/extractors.title: Extractors Reference
references/extractors.description: Extractors are tools for analyzing and extracting information from colors. This reference covers the extractor system in Negarity Color.

references/filters.title: Filters Reference
references/filters.description: Complete reference for all available filters in Negarity Color.

references/methods.title: Methods Reference
references/methods.description: Complete reference for all methods available on Color and MutableColor classes.
